1.comment:
🐾✨ BEASTFOLK (I KNOW WHAT YOU ARE) ✨🐾
⭐ BUNNYCO 'RESEARCH PURPOSES' EDITION — 8 CARDS PER PACK ⭐
1.content:
The legendary collection that DEFINITELY doesn't awaken anything in you! 😏 Contains the most iconic anthropomorphic species ever printed — the same archetypes that made you realize you had very specific preferences about fictional characters! Each booster guarantees 2 rare pulls, 3 uncommons, and 3 commons — perfect for building your "totally just for worldbuilding" collection! 🎴


💎 Pack Contents: 8 randomized cards from the ultimate "research" collection:

- Sneaky Catfolk (Urban roof runners!) 🐱
- Loyal Wolffolk (Pack bond forever!) 🐺
- Adaptive Lizardfolk (Swamp ambush masters!) 🦎
- Clever Foxfolk (Brush tricksters!) 🦊
- Speedy Rabbitfolk (Burrow dashers!) 🐰
- Soaring Birdfolk (Sky superiority!) 🦅
- Mighty Bearfolk (Protective den lords!) 🐻
- Resourceful Ratfolk (Urban survivors!) 🐭

🏆 Chase Cards:
• Golden Khajiit Merchant (★★★★☆) 
• Phantom Thief Catfolk (★★★★☆) 
• Secret Rare Ancient Bearfolk (★★★☆☆)

✨ Premium "Research" Features:

All cards feature exclusive BunnyCo artwork with signature foil patterns!
Each species showcases the anthropomorphic archetypes that definitely didn't awaken anything in you!
Remember your first "wow, they're really well-designed characters" moment? They're all here in gorgeous holographic glory! ✨
Every card captures that magical "it's just good character design!" feeling! 💫

🎯 Campaign Ready: Perfect for any fantasy setting where you need "diverse humanoid cultures for worldbuilding purposes!" These time-tested archetypes have been making adventures... interesting... since tabletop began!
     BunnyCo Friendly (LEGAL) Reminder: These are all sentient PEOPLE with animal traits, not animals with people traits! Totally different thing! Very 
     important distinction! We're all civilized here! 🐰💕
- Everything you need to start your TOTALLY INNOCENT anthropomorphic collection! 🚀

2.content:
🃏 CATFOLK CARD
★★⯪☆☆ | Agility/Stealth

[🏅] SIGNATURE CARD: Khajiit — caravan cat
"Khajiit has wares, if you have coin."

[🧬 BIOLOGY]
- Lifespan: 60-90 years; joints stay springy with age; whiskers silver over time.
- Body: 5'0"-5'8"; lean frames with retractable claws; elongated canine teeth; mobile ears; brush tails for balance.
- Senses: excellent night vision with slit pupils; acute hearing; whisker sensitivity for tight spaces.
- Diet & Metabolism: obligate carnivores with some plant tolerance; quick sugar-to-action response.
- Thermoregulation: prefer warm climates; seek sun-stones and heated surfaces; cold makes them sluggish.
- Healing: baseline recovery; claw sheaths can inflame without scratching posts.
- Reproduction: live birth; 1-3 kits; females often ovulate after mating (mate-triggered timing).
- Aging: claws thicken; pupils stay reactive longer than human eyes.
- Sleep: catnap patterns with dawn/dusk activity spikes.
- Habitat: urban rooftops, warm market districts, caravan routes, anywhere with high vantage points.

**ANTHROPOMORPHISM SLIDER: 65-75% human appearance**

[💘 REPRODUCTION & SEX]
- Baseline: moderate fertility with mate-triggered ovulation; females go into heat 2-3 times yearly if not pregnant; crossbreeding with humans possible in some settings.
- Courtship: tail-base and ear rubs, cheek scenting, slow deliberate blinks, chirps and trills; rough play that softens to gentle kneading when pair-bonded.
- Mechanics: males have human-standard cocks with small soft ridges that help trigger ovulation; females have standard anatomy; sex involves lots of purring, gentle biting, scent marking.
- Arousal: males show ridges more prominently when aroused; females become more vocal and affectionate; both engage in increased scent marking and mutual grooming.
- Fluids: males produce standard loads; females lubricate adequately with increased responsiveness during heat.
- Aftercare: mutual grooming especially around ears and neck, sharing warm spaces, continued purring and scent exchange.

[🏙️ URBAN ADAPTATION]
- Roof-running culture with established routes; market trading networks; nocturnal patrol schedules.

[👁️ ENHANCED SENSES]
- Pupils contract to slits in bright light; half-slit position indicates stress or alertness; motion detection superior to humans.

[⚡ SPECIAL MOVES]
- Pounce Burst (explosive leap), Silent Landing (perfect balance), Night Sight Line (dark vision tracking).

[🎯 HUNTING INSTINCTS]
- Claw-sheath flicks before leaps; tail-tip tremors broadcast spring intent; standard cat behavioral tells apply.

[⚠️ WEAKNESSES]
- Bright lights crush night vision advantage; catnip affects judgment and coordination; scratch-post dependency for claw health.

[⛓️ COUNTERS]
- Use flares to overwhelm night vision, force them onto open ground where pouncing fails, exploit catnip for distraction.

[↔️ DIFFERENTIATION — CATFOLK vs NEKOMATA]

Catfolk are living people with feline traits and normal reproduction; Nekomata are undead/spirit cats with split tails, necromancy, and hearth magic.
[✨] FOIL_PATTERN
- Oil-slick black with moving cat-eye gleam.

3.content:
🃏 WOLFFOLK CARD
★★★☆☆ | Endurance/Hunt

[🏅] SIGNATURE CARD: Holo — the Wise Wolf
"I am Holo, and wise."

[🧬 BIOLOGY]
- Lifespan: 70-100 years; endurance peaks in midlife and maintains well.
- Body: 5'8"-6'6"; digitigrade stance gives leverage; broad chest for lung capacity; pronounced canine teeth.
- Senses: exceptional scent memory lasting days; broad hearing range; motion-focused vision.
- Diet & Metabolism: endurance-built metabolism; steady caloric burn; high appetite in cold weather.
- Thermoregulation: double-coat insulation in cold climates; heat drains speed quickly without cooling.
- Healing: rapid blood clotting; bite and tear wounds scar visibly as pack history.
- Reproduction: small litters raised communally; pack social structure influences breeding rights.
- Aging: muzzle grays early; endurance outlasts top speed by decades.
- Sleep: light, guarded naps; deep crashes after successful hunts.
- Habitat: taiga and tundra corridors, pack territories with seasonal migration routes.

**ANTHROPOMORPHISM SLIDER: 65-75% human appearance**

[💘 REPRODUCTION & SEX]
- Baseline: seasonal fertility peaks; females enter heat 1-2 times yearly with genital swelling and increased scent; pack hierarchy influences mating access.
- Courtship: scent exchange, endurance runs together, sparring displays, pack hunt participation; submission/dominance signals establish consent.
- Mechanics: males develop pronounced knots during climax creating 5-20 minute tie; females accommodate with natural elasticity; pack privacy important for bonding.
- Arousal: males show knot formation when excited; females become receptive with stronger scent production; both engage in increased vocalization and pack behavior.
- Fluids: males produce large knotted loads during tie; females respond with increased lubrication and scent marking.
- Aftercare: mutual grooming, shared food, pack bonding activities; sleeping in contact groups; territory scent marking together.

[🌲 PACK SOCIETY]
- Rank by contribution timing rather than volume; seasonal migration routes; communal pup-rearing responsibilities.

[👃 SCENT COMMUNICATION]
- Complex pheromone phrases mark trails and status; pack emotional states readable through scent; direction marking through urine angles.

[🎵 HOWL PROTOCOLS]
- Rally calls climb in thirds; map-pings use two-note drops; mourning howls add vibrato for pack coordination.

[⚡ SPECIAL MOVES]
- Pack Circle (coordinated surround), Howl Coordination (long-range communication), Blood-Scent Recall (tracking memory).

[⚠️ WEAKNESSES]
- Heat saps endurance quickly; pack dependency creates predictable behaviors; sound/sight line breaks disrupt coordination.

[⛓️ COUNTERS]
- Break communication lines, isolate from pack formation, fight near heat sources where endurance drops.

↔️ DIFFERENTIATION — WOLFFOLK vs WEREWOLF]

- Wolffolk are a born people (65-75% human) with steady biology year-round and no curse; Werewolves are moon-cursed shapeshifters with silver weakness and cycle-driven power spikes.

[✨] FOIL_PATTERN
- Frost-silver with faint paw tracks that appear and disappear.

4.content:
🃏 LIZARDFOLK CARD
★★⯪☆☆ | Ambush/Survival

[🏅] SIGNATURE CARD: Argonian — saxhleel of Black Marsh
"The Hist guide our steps."

[🧬 BIOLOGY]
- Lifespan: 60-90 years; growth slows significantly after adolescence.
- Body: 5'10"-6'8"; powerful tail for balance and swimming; keratin scales providing natural armor; nictitating membranes protect eyes.
- Senses: excellent motion detection; some clades have heat-sensing organs near eyes; good underwater vision.
- Diet & Metabolism: ectothermic-leaning; need basking to reach peak performance; efficient protein processing.
- Thermoregulation: sun and warm water preferred; sluggish in cold; activity dips below comfort temperature.
- Healing: surface scale regrowth quick; deep tissue recovery slow; limited tail regrowth produces fibrous replacement.
- Reproduction: egg-laying; clutches of 2-6; nests in warm sand/soil with communal guarding.
- Aging: scales dull and thicken; ridges become more pronounced; teeth replaced continuously.
- Sleep: torpor-like night rest; early dawn basking to wake metabolism.
- Habitat: wetlands, swamps, river deltas, anywhere with water access and basking sites.

**ANTHROPOMORPHISM SLIDER: 65-75% human appearance**

[💘 REPRODUCTION & SEX]
- Baseline: egg-laying reproduction with external fertilization; warm rain seasons trigger breeding behavior; temperature can influence offspring sex ratios in some bloodlines.
- Courtship: crest and neck color brightening, slow circling displays, shoulder rubbing, gentle chin/cheek touches; tail-tips curl together when bonded.
- Mechanics: males have retractable hemipenes (dual organs) that emerge only during mating; females have single cloacal opening; requires warm, humid environment for successful mating.
- Arousal: males show crest color intensification and territorial head-bobbing; females become more receptive to nest-site preparation; both engage in increased scent marking from hip/leg pores.
- Fluids: males produce fertilizing fluid for external egg fertilization; mating is brief contact rather than prolonged penetration.
- Aftercare: shared nest preparation, alternating basking duties to warm eggs, communal territory defense; parents coordinate heating schedules for proper incubation.

[🌊 WETLAND MASTERY]
- Long breath-holds for underwater ambush; tail propulsion for swimming; slit nostrils resist silt and spray.

[🌡️ TEMPERATURE DEPENDENCY]
- Peak performance requires basking; cold conditions slow thoughts and reflexes; prefer warm, humid environments.

[⚡ SPECIAL MOVES]
- Tail Sweep (trip attacks), Death-Roll Grapple (wrestling technique), Ambush Stillness (perfect camouflage).

[🛡️ NATURAL ARMOR]
- Bony osteoderms provide protection; joints remain scale-soft and vulnerable to targeted strikes.

[⚠️ WEAKNESSES]
- Cold temperatures drastically reduce capability; require regular basking; dawn periods are sluggish.

[⛓️ COUNTERS]
- Chill the air or fight at dawn, churn water to break stealth advantage, maintain distance from tail sweep range.

[↔️ DIFFERENTIATION — LIZARDFOLK vs DRAGONBORN vs KOBOLD]

- Lizardfolk are ectothermic swamp-dwellers with egg-laying and no breath weapons; Dragonborn are warm-blooded with draconic ancestry and elemental breath; Kobolds are small trap-crafting tunnel-dwellers with darkvision and candle obsessions.

[✨] FOIL_PATTERN
- Mossy green with water-ripples that shimmer when tilted.

5.content:
🃏 FOXFOLK CARD
★★★☆☆ | Cunning/Agility

[🏅] SIGNATURE CARD: Tails — twin-tail prodigy
"I've got this!"

[🧬 BIOLOGY]
- Lifespan: 70-100 years; agility preserved through diet and practice.
- Body: 5'0"-5'10"; light frame optimized for quick movement; brush tail for balance and heat regulation.
- Senses: excellent directional hearing; keen scent for cache locations; good night vision.
- Diet & Metabolism: quick sugar-to-action bursts; prefer frequent small meals over large ones.
- Thermoregulation: comfortable in forests and cool nights; overheat in still, warm air.
- Healing: baseline recovery; sprain risk from sudden direction changes and feints.
- Reproduction: small litters; both parents involved in kit protection where culturally supported.
- Aging: tail loses glossy sheen; ear tips accumulate scars from brush living.
- Sleep: coiled sleeping position; ears remain semi-alert even during rest.
- Habitat: forest edges, hillside burrows, anywhere with good cover and escape routes.

**ANTHROPOMORPHISM SLIDER: 65-75% human appearance**

[💘 REPRODUCTION & SEX]
- Baseline: seasonal fertility with females entering heat 1-2 times yearly; males experience corresponding rut periods with increased drive and territorial behavior.
- Courtship: tail wrapping, shoulder rubbing, playful feints that soften to gentle nuzzles; "fox talk" chirps and whines; mutual grooming at jawline signals bonding.
- Mechanics: males develop modest knots during climax creating brief 5-15 minute ties; sex involves lots of playful movement and position changes; tail contact is highly sensitive.
- Arousal: males show knot development and increased scent marking; females become more vocal and affectionate with stronger natural scent; both engage in more physical play.
- Fluids: males produce moderate knotted loads; females lubricate well with seasonal increases during heat cycles.
- Aftercare: mutual grooming, shared cache foods, burrow nesting together; continued playful interaction and scent exchange.

[🏞️ BURROW CULTURE]
- Hillside warren communities; festival trick-arts and lantern-running traditions; decoy den architecture.

[👃 SCENT MASTERY]
- Cache memory through scent association; herb-masking techniques; trail stories readable through smell.

[⚡ SPECIAL MOVES]
- Feint Dash (misdirection movement), Burrow Pop (surprise emergence), Decoy Yips (audio misdirection).

[🌿 ALCHEMICAL KNOWLEDGE]
- Scent-masking herbs and mirage lacquers; non-magical attention-bending through natural substances.

[⚠️ WEAKNESSES]
- Require cover and brush for tactics; bright steady light eliminates advantages; dash attacks have limited endurance.

[⛓️ COUNTERS]
- Deny brush cover, maintain steady illumination, refuse feints by holding center position until dash energy depletes.

[↔️ DIFFERENTIATION — FOXFOLK vs KITSUNE]

- Foxfolk are mortal people with vulpine traits and normal lifespans; Kitsune are supernatural fox-spirits with multiple tails, centuries-long lives, and glamour magic.

[✨] FOIL_PATTERN
- Amber foil with flickering foxfire motes.

6.content:
🃏 RABBITFOLK CARD
🃏 RABBITFOLK CARD
★★⯪☆☆ | Speed/Awareness

[🏅] SIGNATURE CARD: Fran — Viera sky pirate
"The wood tells me where to step."

[🧬 BIOLOGY]
- Lifespan: 60-90 years; early maturation around 14; reflexes sharp from youth.
- Body: 4'0"-5'0"; springy leg tendons for explosive movement; broad field-of-view eyes; large mobile ears.
- Senses: panoramic vision with excellent motion detection; acute low-frequency hearing; whisker sensitivity.
- Diet & Metabolism: high-energy burst capability; efficient at steady grazing diets; sweet foods provide quick energy.
- Thermoregulation: heat vents through large ears; cold requires shelter and group warmth.
- Healing: light bones resilient but prone to stress fractures; bruising common from evasive maneuvers.
- Reproduction: moderate fertility in humanoid lines; strong extended family networks for child-rearing.
- Aging: hock joints stiffen gradually; ear cartilage thickens with age.
- Sleep: short, frequent rest periods; prefer secure burrow-like sleeping spaces.
- Habitat: hedgerow networks, field edges, underground warrens with multiple exits.

**ANTHROPOMORPHISM SLIDER: 65-75% human appearance**

[💘 REPRODUCTION & SEX]
- Baseline: frequent fertility cycles making them nearly always receptive; males maintain steady rutting baseline with seasonal intensity spikes; strong pair-bonding during active periods.
- Courtship: hand-holding walks, cheek rubbing and nose touching, invitation for ear-scratching, sitting close together; sharing favorite foods and nesting preparations.
- Mechanics: smooth genitalia with no knots or barbs; quick, energetic coupling with multiple short sessions preferred over prolonged encounters; ear contact during sex is highly pleasurable.
- Arousal: both sexes become more tactile and cuddly; males show consistent readiness; females signal receptivity through increased grooming and nesting behavior.
- Fluids: males produce frequent small loads; females lubricate readily and often; both recover quickly for repeated encounters.
- Aftercare: mutual grooming especially around ears, shared meals of sweet foods, nest-tidying together; lots of close physical contact and gentle touches.

[🏠 WARREN SOCIETY]
- Multi-exit safety architecture; community muster drills; collective child-rearing in secure underground networks.

[👂 EAR COMMUNICATION]
- Ear positions encode quick signals - flat for hide, half-tilt for wait, full-tall for move silently, tip-flick for danger.

[⚡ SPECIAL MOVES]
- Burst Hop (explosive acceleration), Zig-Zag Break (evasion pattern), Ear-Signal Comms (silent coordination).

[🏗️ WARREN ENGINEERING]
- Load-bearing tunnel systems; rolling collapse traps; bolt-holes surfacing in concealed locations.

[⚠️ WEAKNESSES]
- Explosive movement strains tendons; vulnerable to vertical barriers; panic response can override tactical thinking.

[⛓️ COUNTERS]
- Use nets and overhead barriers, channel rather than chase directly, attack from above where zig-zag patterns fail.

[✨] FOIL_PATTERN
- Pastel meadow with quick flash lines across the surface.

7.content:
🃏 BIRDFOLK CARD
★★⯪☆☆ | Flight/Skirmish

[🏅] SIGNATURE CARD: Revali — Rito champion
"The skies are mine."

[🧬 BIOLOGY]
- Lifespan: 60-100 years; molt cycles mark seasons and age progression.
- Body: 5'0"-6'5"; hollow-core bones with internal struts; pronounced sternum keel; feather mantle along shoulders/forearms allowing gliding.
- Senses: exceptional long-range vision; quick focus adjustment; sensitive to pressure changes predicting weather.
- Diet & Metabolism: high metabolic rate requiring dense calories; steady hydration critical at altitude.
- Thermoregulation: down underlayer for insulation; risk hypothermia when soaked; heat dissipation during high flight.
- Healing: feathers regrow on seasonal schedule; wing/shoulder tendon injuries require extended rest.
- Reproduction: egg-laying; small clutches of 1-3 in modern lineages; cliff or elevated nests; shared brooding duties.
- Aging: primary feathers fade; bone pneumatization stable; voice deepens with reduced range.
- Sleep: perch-sleeping common; experienced fliers can micro-nap during long glides.
- Habitat: mountainous regions, cliff cities, anywhere with good thermals and elevation.

**ANTHROPOMORPHISM SLIDER: 65-75% human appearance**

[💘 REPRODUCTION & SEX]
- Baseline: seasonal breeding peaks in spring/early summer; partners develop strong nesting instincts and territorial behavior; modern urban lines may show mild year-round cycles.
- Courtship: aerial displays, gift exchanges of shiny objects, shared preening of hair/feathers, sky-dancing together; co-decorating shared sleeping spaces.
- Mechanics: human-appearing external anatomy; egg formation occurs post-conception; brooding uses warm abdominal brood patch; mating includes lots of wing-touching and aerial foreplay.
- Arousal: both sexes show wing displays and enhanced plumage; males perform elaborate flight patterns; females respond with nest-preparation behavior and receptive posturing.
- Fluids: males produce standard fertilizing loads; females develop eggs internally after successful mating; both engage in mutual preening during intimate moments.
- Aftercare: shared nest preparation, synchronized brooding schedules, mutual feather grooming; continued aerial bonding flights and territory establishment.

[🌬️ FLIGHT MASTERY]
- Gliding on updrafts; short powered flight bursts with training; superior three-dimensional movement and positioning.

[🪶 WING MORPHOLOGY]
- Raptor builds for diving attacks; corvid builds for agility; seabird builds for endurance - specialization affects combat style.

[⚡ SPECIAL MOVES]
- Stoop Dive (high-speed attack), Grapple-and-Drop (aerial wrestling), Crosswind Turn (evasive maneuver).

[🏔️ ALTITUDE ADAPTATION]
- Hypoxia tolerance; thermal reading for navigation; superior balance and spatial awareness.

[⚠️ WEAKNESSES]
- Grounded in low ceilings; molting periods reduce flight capability; tendon vulnerability during aerial maneuvers.

[⛓️ COUNTERS]
- Force indoor combat, disrupt thermals with smoke, target wing joints during stoop wind-up timing.


[↔️ DIFFERENTIATION — BIRDFOLK vs KENKU vs TENGU]

- Birdfolk are living people with limited flight and normal speech; Kenku are cursed corvids with perfect mimicry but no original speech; Tengu are mountain wind-spirits with martial discipline and sword mastery.

[✨] FOIL_PATTERN
- Blue-white with thermal spirals rising under light.

8.content:
🃏 BEARFOLK CARD
★★★☆☆ | Might/Guardian

[🏅] SIGNATURE CARD: Beorn — skin-changer of the Carrock
"Some men are better bears."

[🧬 BIOLOGY]
- Lifespan: 80-120 years; strength peaks long and maintains well into advanced age.
- Body: 6'0"-8'0"; immense forelimb power; claws for digging and defense; thick dermis; dense muscle mass.
- Senses: exceptional smell detection; adequate hearing; near-sight functional but not sharp.
- Diet & Metabolism: seasonal fat cycling; high protein and berry intake; omnivorous with regional preferences.
- Thermoregulation: cold-hardy with thick subcutaneous fat; heat slows movement without shade and water.
- Healing: thick skin resists cuts; deep wounds bleed heavily but clot strong; impressive pain tolerance.
- Reproduction: low fertility with intense cub protection instincts; communal raising where culturally supported.
- Aging: mass increases then stabilizes; scars accumulate as territorial dispute records.
- Sleep: deep winter torpor in appropriate climates; otherwise dusk/dawn activity patterns.
- Habitat: boreal forests, salmon runs, berry valleys; established den sites marking family lineages.

**ANTHROPOMORPHISM SLIDER: 65-75% human appearance**

[💘 REPRODUCTION & SEX]
- Baseline: yearly spring fertility peak; females enter calm but intense heat with increased affection and cuddling; males experience persistent but controlled rut with protective courting behavior.
- Courtship: gentle forehead touches, sharing honey/berries and warm drinks, building cozy den-like spaces with blankets; slow-swaying "bear dance" and protective embraces.
- Mechanics: human-standard anatomy; males may have small penis bone (ursine trait) but no knot; sex is slow, powerful, and protective; focus on comfort and safety.
- Arousal: both sexes show increased protective behavior; males become more gift-bearing and territory-establishing; females seek comfort and nest-building activities.
- Fluids: males produce warm, substantial loads; females respond with adequate lubrication; both prioritize partner comfort and satisfaction.
- Aftercare: shared honey and warm foods, mutual grooming especially around head/shoulders, building comfortable sleeping arrangements; deep chest humming and protective embraces.

[🛡️ PROTECTIVE INSTINCTS]
- Cub protection is absolute priority; touching cubs without permission considered act of war; expect extreme territorial response.

[❄️ SEASONAL ADAPTATION]
- Metabolism can drop for winter torpor; waking mid-hibernation leaves them slow but pain-resistant.

[⚡ SPECIAL MOVES]
- Maul-Hug Crush (grappling attack), Shoulder Charge (momentum strike), Stand-and-Roar (morale break).

[🐟 RESOURCE RIGHTS]
- Ancient salmon-run truces; territorial law based on seasonal resource access; clan exile for fishing-ground violations.

[⚠️ WEAKNESSES]
- Heat exhaustion in warm weather; slow acceleration from standing start; vulnerable to sustained ranged attacks.

[⛓️ COUNTERS]
- Bleed and kite at range, use fire and noise to break charge commitment, never allow both arms to lock in grapple.

[✨] FOIL_PATTERN
- Copper-brown with slow rolling grain like fur in wind.

9.content:
🃏 RATFOLK CARD
★★★☆☆ | Swarm/Urban

[🏅] SIGNATURE CARD: Splinter — wise sewer sensei
"We choose who we become."

[🧬 BIOLOGY]
- Lifespan: 50-80 years; fast generational turnover enabling rapid adaptation.
- Body: 3'6"-5'0"; flexible spine; prominent whiskers; prehensile tails in some family lines; nimble hands.
- Senses: excellent low-light navigation; whisker touch-mapping; scent-based route tagging.
- Diet & Metabolism: opportunistic omnivores thriving on scraps; quick energy from carbohydrates; efficient nutrient extraction.
- Thermoregulation: prefer warm, dry interior spaces; sensitive to damp cold conditions.
- Healing: scar readily; high infection risk in unsanitary conditions; quick recovery when clean.
- Reproduction: high fertility with litter-based family structures; communal child-rearing systems.
- Aging: teeth overgrow without proper wear; tails accumulate scars from tight-space navigation.
- Sleep: communal sleep piles for warmth; primarily nocturnal activity patterns.
- Habitat: urban sewers and building infrastructure, anywhere with salvage opportunities and hidden access.

**ANTHROPOMORPHISM SLIDER: 65-75% human appearance**

[💘 REPRODUCTION & SEX]
- Baseline: very high fertility with frequent breeding opportunities; communal mating systems based on warren hierarchy; multiple partners common.
- Courtship: successful scavenging displays, sharing found treasures, warren improvement projects; status through resource contribution rather than physical dominance.
- Mechanics: quick, efficient mating focused on reproduction rather than pleasure; males have proportional anatomy; females accommodate frequent breeding cycles.
- Arousal: triggered by resource abundance and warren security; males compete through provision rather than combat; females select based on survival contribution.
- Fluids: males produce frequent small loads optimized for conception; females cycle rapidly when conditions allow.
- Aftercare: communal food sharing, nest improvement, group grooming; survival and family welfare prioritized over individual bonding.

[🏙️ URBAN ECOLOGY]
- Sewer and infrastructure networks; salvage micro-economies; hidden lift and pulley systems for resource movement.

[🗺️ SCENT NAVIGATION]
- Route marking through perfumed scent-maps; oil dots for directions, chalk musk for access points, bitter sap for danger zones.

[⚡ SPECIAL MOVES]
- Swarm Overwhelm (numbers advantage), Chute Scurry (infrastructure movement), Gnaw-Through (destructive capability).

[🦠 DISEASE RESISTANCE]
- Natural immunity to common urban plagues while remaining potential carriers; communities use quarantine protocols rather than exclusion.

[⚠️ WEAKNESSES]
- Individual vulnerability when separated from group; poor performance in clean, bright environments; social structure collapse without leadership.

[⛓️ COUNTERS]
- Create firebreaks and chokepoints, eliminate food scent trails, target group speakers to scatter organized resistance.

[✨] FOIL_PATTERN
- Iron-gray with darting flecks like eyes in darkness.

11.content:
🃏 YOKAI CARD
★★★☆☆ | Trick/Threshold

[🏅] SIGNATURE CARD: No-Face — bathhouse enigma
"Names bind stronger than chains."

[🧬 BIOLOGY]
- Lifespan: varies by anchor strength; festivals and anniversaries spike power; neglect causes fading.
- Body: wildly variable - animal spirits, animated objects, place-bound presences, humanoid forms; consistency within categories.
- Senses: perceive boundaries humans ignore - taboos, thresholds, forgotten names, emotional residue.
- Diet & Metabolism: sustained by attention, offerings, fear, or reverence; substance varies by type.
- Thermoregulation: often incorporeal; physical forms follow their base nature.
- Healing: regenerate according to anchor strength; spiritual wounds harder to mend than physical.
- Reproduction: manifest from accumulated belief, trauma, or spiritual energy rather than biological processes.
- Aging: power and complexity increase with age and attention; ancient yokai become regional legends.
- Habitat: boundaries between worlds - doorways, bridges, crossroads, forgotten shrines.

[💘 REPRODUCTION & SEX]
- Baseline: most yokai can engage sexually if they choose corporeal form; no biological reproduction but may create spiritual offspring through shared energy.
- Courtship: varies wildly by type - some seduce through glamour, others through bargains or gifts; consent often tied to crossing thresholds or accepting offerings.
- Mechanics: physical sensation possible when manifested; sexual energy feeds many types; encounters often have supernatural side effects or bargain implications.
- Arousal: spiritual rather than purely physical; partners may experience supernatural sensations, shared visions, or temporary abilities.
- Fluids: may produce ectoplasmic substitutes or nothing at all; focus on energy exchange rather than physical fluids.
- Aftercare: depends on yokai type - some disappear immediately, others become protective or possessive; offerings and proper etiquette prevent negative consequences.

[🚪 BOUNDARY PHYSICS]
- Threshold crossings without proper acknowledgment constitute consent to be played with; edges between spaces thin reality.

[🎭 CATEGORICAL TYPES]
- Animal spirits (kitsune, tanuki), tsukumogami (haunted objects), place-bound entities obey different rules and respond to different approaches.

[⚡ SPECIAL MOVES]
- Illusion Play (reality distortion), Fear Spike (terror projection), Boundary Trespass (space violation).

[🎎 APPEASEMENT PROTOCOLS]
- Rice and sweets for childlike tricksters; sake for proud elders; coins at crossings; announcing presence shows respect.

[⚠️ WEAKNESSES]
- Bound by their nature and category rules; proper identification limits their options; correct offerings can pacify or banish.

[⛓️ COUNTERS]
- Name and categorize to narrow abilities, honor boundary rituals instead of escalating, use appropriate appeasement rather than force.

[↔️ DIFFERENTIATION — YOKAI vs ONI]

- Yokai are diverse boundary spirits (animal spirits, haunted objects, place-bound entities); Oni are specifically rage-born demon ogres with horns, kanabō weapons, and hedonistic culture.

[✨] FOIL_PATTERN
- Paper-lantern glow over deep indigo with drifting masks.
